title: Unknown
outcome: A wave of small but conspicuous BCI scoring glitches prompts mass, performative compliance. Ordinary citizens adapt routines in exaggerated ways to avoid suspicion. The system struggles to distinguish genuine from artificial behaviors; pressure mounts within the Council to regain control.

events.description: BCI scoring errors cause widespread, unexplained point drops across the city. Panic spikes as people scramble to display visible compliance in public spaces.
A sudden surge of synchronized 'compliance displays' appears citywide: citizens over-perform public service, neighborly acts, and system praise, leading to artificial, uncanny calm.
Council Harmonists warn that the data flood from excessive displays is making it harder to identify genuine noncompliance, but Innovators push for stricter behavioral analysis.
Citizens begin quietly resisting, forming small circles that deliberately act unpredictably. Directorate surveillance increases, intent on reasserting BCI control over daily life.
